summary: The Chinese Spy Balloon Assessment Act mandates the Secretary of Defense to report to the House and Senate Armed Services Committees on the national security effects of the Chinese high-altitude surveillance balloon shot down in February 2023. The report must include an analysis of recovered technology and materials, their countries of origin, and any effects on military installations. The report is to be submitted within 90 days after the act's enactment, primarily unclassified, but allows for a classified annex.
